Automobiles
lead_paragraph: Fernando Alonso is not letting his team’s involvement in a spying scandal distract him from trying to win a third straight Formula One title. Alonso clinched the pole position yesterday in qualifying for today’s Italian Grand Prix in Monza. Alonso won his second pole of the season with a time of 1 minute 21.997 seconds on the 3.6-mile circuit.He drives for McLaren, which has been accused of obtaining confidential technical data about Ferrari’s cars. The World Motor Sport Council will hold a hearing on the spying case Thursday after the world governing body, known as FIA, said new evidence had emerged.
